page.title: 11Education in Bawdeswell
page.content: As there is no provision for nursery education in the State system, 22 children aged 3 to 5 attend the voluntarily run Bawdeswell playgroup. This is run by a supervisor, Corrine France, and an assistant, Wendy Riches, who are employed by a committee comprised of the childrens' mothers. The playgroup is a member of the Pre-School Playgroups Association which gives advice and assistance where required as well as organising meetings and events. 50 children of ages 5 to 11 go to the village Primary School. Older children, 11 to 16, are transported by coach to Reepham High School. Sixth form education is at Fakenham, Norwich or Wymondham and the children travel by public transport or private car.
